chapter.title: What's New in OpenAM Policy Agents
chapter.para: This release of OpenAM Policy Agents fixes a number of issues, and provides the following additional features.

listitem.para: The Java EE agent goto URL can now be modified (OPENAM-1299).

If you have already validated the URLs in your web policy agent configuration, you can disable URL validation during the bootstrap phase using the com.forgerock.agents.ext.url.validation.disable property (OPENAM-1270).
Policy agent now allows you to set the Login URL based on the incoming FQDN (OPENAM-1265).
Web policy agents now support failover across multiple naming URLs (OPENAM-1258).
Policy agent now allows you to configure the naming of the URL validation net-connect timeout (OPENAM-1257).
Policy agents now support IPv6 for notenforced IP addresses (OPENAM-1256).
Policy agents now support Apache HTTP Server 2.4 (OPENAM-1195).
Web policy policy agents now let you enable and disable Cache-Control headers for unauthenticated sessions (OPENAM-1087).
Web policy agents now let you preserve POST data when working with URI-based load balancing (OPENAM-980).
Web policy agents now let you configure whether to do an HTTP 302 redirect after processing the LARES POST (OPENAM-936).
Web policy agents can now conditionally redirect users based on the incoming request URL (OPENAM-849).
Web policy agents can now mark persistent cookies as HTTPOnly, to prevent scripts and third-party programs from accessing the cookies (OPENAM-804).
Policy agent file names now include the version number (OPENAM-337).
The auto-submitting form in FormLoginContent.txt now parses as valid XML (OPENAM-674).
Policy agent file names now include the version number (OPENAM-337).
